page.title: 03Seagry House Fire.
page.content: On May the 8TH 1949 there was a fire in Seagry House.A week before the fire started the butler left and a new butler came,his name was Mr.Head.The previous butler Mr.Brentnor had a routine.Just before Lady Cowley retired for the night he checked that the fire in her room was safe and that no lighted cigarettes were left around because Lady Cowley was a chain smoker.This new butler didn't have a routine.Therefore on May 8th we think that Lady Cowley went to sleep in the chair with a cigarette in her hand.The butler went to open the door and the handle was red hot and he burnt his hand and then the flames flared up in his face.The fire was so big that people in Wootton Bassett saw it.Fire engines came from Wootton Bassett,Malmesbury and Chippenham.
